ibis.ipl
Class PortType

java.lang.Object
  ibis.ipl.CapabilitySet
      ibis.ipl.PortType

public final class PortType
extends CapabilitySet

This class represents the type of a receive or send port. A PortType is a capability set. The possible values in this set are included here. Note that Ibis implementations may define additional capabilities.

Field Summary
static String COMMUNICATION_FIFO
          This capability describes that messages from a sendport are delivered to the receiveport(s) in the order in which they were sent.
static String COMMUNICATION_NUMBERED
          This capability describes that messages are given global sequence numbers so that the application can order them.
static String COMMUNICATION_RELIABLE
          This capability describes that communication is reliable.
static String COMMUNICATION_RELIABLE_UNSAFE
          This capability describes that communication is reliable but not safe enough to use on open networks.
static String COMMUNICATION_UNRELIABLE
          This capability describes that communication is unreliable.
static String CONNECTION_DIRECT
          This capability describes that -only- direct connection setup is used.
static String CONNECTION_DOWNCALLS
          This capability describes that connection downcalls are supported.
static String CONNECTION_LIGHT
          This capability describes that lightweight connection setup is used.
static String CONNECTION_MANY_TO_MANY
          This capability describes that a sendport can have multiple outgoing connections, and receiveports can have multiple incoming connections.
static String CONNECTION_MANY_TO_ONE
          This capability describes that a sendport can have at most one outgoing connection, but receiveports can have multiple incoming connections.
static String CONNECTION_ONE_TO_MANY
          This capability describes that a sendport can have more than one outgoing connection, but receiveports can only have one incoming connection.
static String CONNECTION_ONE_TO_ONE
          This capability describes that a sendport can have at most one outgoing connection, and a receiveport can have at most one incoming connection.
static String CONNECTION_TIMEOUT

static String CONNECTION_UPCALLS

static String RECEIVE_AUTO_UPCALLS
          This capability describes that message upcalls are supported without the need to poll for them.

          This capability describes that polls are supported.
static String RECEIVE_POLL_UPCALLS

static String SERIALIZATION_BYTE
          This capability describes that readByte/writeByte and readArray/writeArray(byte[]) are supported.

CONNECTION_ONE_TO_ONE

public static final String CONNECTION_ONE_TO_ONE
This capability describes that a sendport can have at most one outgoing connection, and a receiveport can have at most one incoming connection.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Constant Field Values

CONNECTION_LIGHT

public static final String CONNECTION_LIGHT
This capability describes that lightweight connection setup is used. Lightweight connections are cheaper to create and often use less kernel resources. On the downside, they are likely to have a higher latency and lower throughput.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
WARNING: This is an Experimental feature of the IPL. It may not function correctly, future releases of the IPL may have a revised API for this feature, or it may be removed completely.

CONNECTION_ULTRALIGHT

public static final String CONNECTION_ULTRALIGHT
This capability describes that ultra-lightweight connection setup is used. These connections are even cheaper to create and maintain than lightweight connections. They are not reliable, however, and can not be combined with connection up/downcalls. In addition, a maximum message size may be imposed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
WARNING: This is an Experimental feature of the IPL. It may not function correctly, future releases of the IPL may have a revised API for this feature, or it may be removed completely.

CONNECTION_DIRECT

public static final String CONNECTION_DIRECT
This capability describes that -only- direct connection setup is used. This prevents ibis from using any connection setup scheme that does not result in a direct connection between the two machines. Note that using this option may severely restrict the connectivity of an ibis instance.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
WARNING: This is an Experimental feature of the IPL. It may not function correctly, future releases of the IPL may have a revised API for this feature, or it may be removed completely.

RECEIVE_EXPLICIT

public static final String RECEIVE_EXPLICIT
This capability describes that explicit receive is supported.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final String RECEIVE_TIMEOUT
This capability describes that explicit receive with a timeout is supported.

RECEIVE_POLL

public static final String RECEIVE_POLL
This capability describes that polls are supported.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RECEIVE_AUTO_UPCALLS

public static final String RECEIVE_AUTO_UPCALLS
This capability describes that message upcalls are supported without the need to poll for them.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RECEIVE_POLL_UPCALLS

public static final String RECEIVE_POLL_UPCALLS
This capability describes that message upcalls are supported but the user must to poll for them. An implementation that claims that it has this, may also do autoupcalls, but polling does no harm. When an application asks for this (and not autoupcalls), it must poll. For this to work, poll must be supported and requested!

See Also:
Constant Field Values

COMMUNICATION_FIFO

public static final String COMMUNICATION_FIFO
This capability describes that messages from a sendport are delivered to the receiveport(s) in the order in which they were sent.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

COMMUNICATION_NUMBERED

public static final String COMMUNICATION_NUMBERED
This capability describes that messages are given global sequence numbers so that the application can order them. The numbering is per send port name.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

COMMUNICATION_RELIABLE

public static final String COMMUNICATION_RELIABLE
This capability describes that communication is reliable.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SERIALIZATION_DATA

public static final String SERIALIZATION_DATA
This capability describes that read/write and readArray/writeArray of primitive types are supported.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SERIALIZATION_OBJECT

public static final String SERIALIZATION_OBJECT
This capability describes that some sort of object serialization is supported. Applications may ask for a specific implementation by specifying, for instance, serialization.object.sun.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
